column1: Art Institute of Chicago////Neoclassical architecture encompasses the main hall and exhibit areas
column2: which hearken back to the days when marble was the building material of choice. A coatroom accepts your loose bags
column4: and handheld objects for a marginal fee. Beyond are some pretty incredible displays
column5: beginning with knights' armour and weapons
column6: and then a host of statues straight out of the late 19th century. The American and contemporary collections engulf a huge swathe of material going from furniture to personal portraits to massive sculptures that lack any descriptive element except 'entirely abstract.'
